title: How Many Calories in Grilled Cheese?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in grilled cheese sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in Grilled Cheese?
assumptions: Classic grilled cheese: 2 slices white bread, 2 slices American cheese, 1 tbsp butter for grilling; no add-ons.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, cheese brand, butter amount, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard grilled cheese sandwich contains about 350 kcal and 12 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white
Add tomato slices and reduce butter to 1/2 tbsp

faqs.q: How many calories in a grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for a standard version with white bread and American cheese.

faqs.q: What are the macros in grilled cheese?
faqs.a: About 30 g carbs, 20 g fat, 12 g protein per sandwich.

faqs.q: Is grilled cheese high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 800 mg due to cheese and bread; opt for low-sodium options to reduce.

faqs.q: How does cheese type affect calories in grilled cheese?
faqs.a: Cheddar adds more fat/calories (~400 kcal total) than American; low-fat cheese lowers to ~250 kcal.

faqs.q: Can I make grilled cheese lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, use low-fat cheese, whole grain bread, and minimal butter or cooking spray to cut ~50-100 kcal.
